articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Trump must remember that the only way to bring home Israeli prisoners is to respect the ceasefire between Israel and Hamas, senior Hamas official Sami Abu Zuhri told Reuters.
articles.title: Ceasefire is only way to bring Israeli prisoners home, Hamas official says

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: King Abdullah has said he rejected any moves to annex land and displace Palestinians.
articles.title: Trump and Jordan's king set for tense meeting on Gaza's future

articles.author: Poppy Mcpherson, Josh Smith
articles.description: After U.S. President Donald Trump's administration froze donations in January to Cambodia's largest demining organization, which works to clear the countryside of deadly remnants of Washington's past wars in Southeast Asia, the group announced new funding - from China.
articles.title: US aid freeze risks handing influence to China in Beijing's backyard

articles.author: Aaron Ross, Maria Martinez
articles.description: They line up by the hundreds to meet recruiters at schools in provincial towns and convention halls in large cities, some carrying advanced diplomas, others with only a primary education to their name.
articles.title: Insight: In search of economic boost, some African countries send workers abroad

articles.author: Jeffrey Dastin, Elizabeth Howcroft
articles.description: World leaders gathered on Tuesday for the second day and plenary session of the Paris summit on artificial intelligence, as U.S. willingness to sign onto a statement championing sustainable AI remained in question.
articles.title: Europe looks to embrace AI at Paris summit's 2nd day while global consensus unclear

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Bangladesh is working towards holding general elections by December, the party of former Prime Minister Khaleda Zia said after some of its officials held a meeting with Muhammad Yunus, the chief adviser to the interim government.
articles.title: Bangladesh opposition says government aims to hold polls by December

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Islamic State armed group attacked military bases in Somalia's northeastern Puntland state overnight with suicide car and motorbike bombs, a military official said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Islamic State attacks military bases in Somalia's Puntland with car and motorbike bombs

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres urged Hamas to continue with the planned release of hostages on Tuesday, a day after the Palestinian militant group announced its intention to halt the exchange.
articles.title: UN chief: Renewed hostilities in Gaza must be avoided at all costs

articles.author: Raphael Satter
articles.description: A refugee advocate caught up in an Italian political scandal over the recent release of an alleged war criminal was targeted using sophisticated spyware, according to an alert sent to him by iPhone maker Apple .
articles.title: Italy-based refugee advocate says he was targeted using spyware

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said on Tuesday that Canada would seek to highlight the negative impact of the United States' steel and aluminium tariffs and that - if needed - the response from Canada would be firm and clear.
articles.title: Canada will respond to 'unacceptable' US tariffs strongly and firmly if needed, Trudeau says
